suppressedVulnerabilityIds.notes: Log4J SocketServer is not used, so not vulnerable

suppressedVulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-17571
suppressedVulnerabilities.description: Included in Log4j 1.2 is a SocketServer class that is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data which can be exploited to remotely execute arbitrary code when combined with a deserialization gadget when listening to untrusted network traffic for log data. This affects Log4j versions up to 1.2 up to 1.2.17.

suppressedVulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-9488
suppressedVulnerabilities.description: Improper validation of certificate with host mismatch in Apache Log4j SMTP appender. This could allow an SMTPS connection to be intercepted by a man-in-the-middle attack which could leak any log messages sent through that appender.
